titleStmt.title: Of the opening of rivers for navigation, the benefit exemplified, by the two Avons of Salisbury and Bristol. : with a Mediterranean passage by water for billanders of thirty tun, between Bristol and London, with the results.
titleStmt.author: Mathew, Francis, Esquire.

titleStmt.title: Of the opening of rivers for navigation, the benefit exemplified, by the two Avons of Salisbury and Bristol. : with a Mediterranean passage by water for billanders of thirty tun, between Bristol and London, with the results.
titleStmt.author: Mathew, Francis, Esquire.

biblFull.extent: [4], 16, 5-15 p., [1] leaf of plates : ill., ports.

notesStmt.note: Includes "A mediterranean passage by water between the two towns Lynn and Yarmouth, &c." on pages 5-15 at end.
Reproduction of original in: British Library.

Of the opening of rivers for navigation the benefit exemplified by the two Avons of Salisbury and Bristol : with a Mediterranean passage by water for billanders of thirty tun, between Bristol and London, with the results -- Mediterranean passage by water between the two towns Lynn and Yarmouth, &c.
